intro: Paronychia albella, commonly known as the white-flowered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Paronychia albella is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to withstand drought conditions.
